intro: Lasianthus grandifolius, commonly known as the large-leaf lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a tropical look.
